N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 310.1 - Participation of state-operated campuses in interinstitutional arrangements

State Regulations

The chancellor, or his designee, is authorized to approve
the participation of the university and any State-operated campus, through
contract or otherwise, in interinstitutional arrangements providing for
voluntary cooperative operation or use of facilities and academic resources
among nonpublic and public institutions of higher education, on a regional
basis, including any cooperative association of such educational institutions
formed as a corporation, in accordance with further guidelines as shall be
developed and issued by the chancellor with the approval of the Director of the

Budget, provided that: (a) the
chancellor, or his designee, shall review and approve the terms and conditions
of participation in any interinstitutional corporation, including the charter
and bylaws thereof, and may thereafter authorize a chief administrative officer
of a State-operated campus, or his designee, to participate on the governing
body of such a corporation; (b) the
university's commitments, including facilities and resources, to any
interinstitutional arrangement, association or corporation shall be made in
compliance with all provisions of law and regulations governing the university
and shall not exceed funds appropriated or otherwise lawfully available to the
university therefor in the fiscal year in which the commitments are made and so
certified by the Director of the Budget; (c) the financial standing and operations of
any interinstitutional arrangement, association or corporation shall be subject
to post-audit by the State Comptroller; and
(d) an annual report of any
interinstitutional arrangement, association, or corporation shall be submitted
to the chancellor. Notes
